qas.question: How often are elections for mayor held in Boston?
What kind of power does the mayor have?
Who oversees the Boston Public Schools?

context: Boston has a strong mayor – council government system in which the mayor (elected <a0_0>every fourth year<a0_0/>) has <a1_0>extensive executive power<a1_0/>. <a2_0>Marty Walsh<a2_0/> became Mayor in January 2014, his predecessor Thomas Menino's twenty-year tenure having been the longest in the city's history. The Boston City Council is elected every two years; there are nine district seats, and four citywide "at-large" seats. <a3_0>The School Committee<a3_0/>, which oversees the Boston Public Schools, is appointed by the mayor.
